Posted By: strigen (2/24/2011 2:39:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Scathe Zombies are not crappy. Stop saying that. Sure, they are not **tournament viable**, but that's something completely different. A crappy card is something ***no-one*** would play, and this is certainly not one of them. At least not for me.  
  
EDIT: To expand my previous assertions, I have this to say: I am a casual player, and I actually think that, within that setting, Scathe Zombies is **the** quint-essential zombie card. It has been with M:TG since its very start, and in addition to that, it has its wonderful flavour text. That, and the fact that it is a simple and unassuming vanilla, turns into, dare I say, the most iconic zombie card ever. I would gladly put it into each and every zombie deck I were to make.

Posted By: Lord_of_the_Real (1/28/2012 4:09:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Nostalgic, but not really in a good way.  
  
Way back when, when I got a [soulless one](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=soulless one) in a booster and really wanted to make a zombie deck. Sadly, I had very few zombies in my limited card collection, so I was forced to use my scathe zombies. Even with the help they got from the warchief and the courier, they just were never good.  
  
When [warpath ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=warpath ghoul) came out, I was really pleased cause I could take out my scathe zombies and give the zombie deck another shot (I stopped playing magic for a long time until after alara, so I missed a lot of zombie support in the interim). And now with Innistrad, I can retire warpath for [Diregraf Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diregraf Ghoul)  
  
So I get nostalgia from this, but its not really good nostalgia...
posts.html:

When warpath ghoul came out, I was really pleased cause I could take out my scathe zombies and give the zombie deck another shot (I stopped playing magic for a long time until after alara, so I missed a lot of zombie support in the interim). So I get nostalgia from this, but its not really good nostalgia...

posts.post_content:
@Hayw00d0909: Congratulations, you've foreseen [Diregraf Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diregraf Ghoul) months before it was printed.
  
Also, [Walking Corpse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walking Corpse) finally puts it to its final rest. Innistrad is giving zombies a lot of love.
  
[Warpath Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warpath Ghoul) isn't very far behind either.
  
And yes, the art really looks like [Brain Gorgers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brain Gorgers), which happens to be one of my favourite zombies (and creatures) ever.
